climbs.name: Social D
climbs.fa: Kenn Kenaga, Pat Brennan & Brad Singer, August 1999

content.description: Climb thin seam past two bolts (can place small cams too), into a thin finger crack and then out the nice, steep left-slanting hand crack.
content.protection: 2 bolts. Standard rack up to #3 camalot.Bolted ring anchor to the left of the top out or can sling tree/place #3 camalot size piece.
content.location: Social D climbs the crack system off the pillar on the North side of black bluff.

climbs.name: Shooting Star
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan, Brad Singer & John Cardmon, August 1999

content.description: Starts off in a nice fingers dihedral, pull a small bulge roof.Traverse to the left passed an undercling flake, work your way up and over then go right to a shelf.Transition over to the face and up.
content.protection:
5 bolts, s

tandard rack to #3 blue Camalot with d

oubles in finger sizes, c

ouple runners

Bolted anchor/rap shared with routes left
content.location: Located on the right side on the north face of Black Bluff.

climbs.name: Scratch and Sniff
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan, Brad Singer & John Cardmon, July 1999

content.description:
There are two hand cracks next to each other on the center-right side of black bluff north face.

Scratch and sniff is the right crack.

Amazing jams on clean quality rock. Both climbs are must do's! Great duo with Black Bart.
content.protection:
standard rack to #3 blue camalot

bolted anchors atop
content.location: Located on the center-right side on the north face of black bluff.

climbs.name: Powder Finger
climbs.fa: DS: John Cardmon, Brad Singer, Pat Brennan, DF: Brad singer, Eric Odenthal, Chris Miller, David LePere, 2000

content.description: In the middle of shooting star and Aurora Borealis. Follow two bolts up a finger crack into the dike with the undercling traverse, stay direct and up to 3 bolts.
content.protection:
7 bolts, standard rack to #1

Bolted anchor/rap
content.location: North face of Black Bluff, Right Side.

content.description:
The beautiful colorful lichen at the start is quite interesting. The crack and the surface is covered in lichen and so will your face..so as the name goes....

WARNING:

The landing area is very sketchy and dangerous with multiple jagged rocks right below the lip move. Don't blow it.
content.location: Located near the north face on Black Bluff on the very right side. You can't miss the diving board boulders.

climbs.name: Control Tower
climbs.fa: Brad Singer, Kenn Kenaga, Dave LePere & Eric Odenthal, June 2000

content.description: Climb the north side of the obvious tower that sits in front of black bart. Make fun moves past first bolt, reach around roof to clip the second (crux), then pull up on small crimpers past one more bolt and optional mid-sized piece (.5/.75 camalot) to the top.

climbs.name: Black Beard
climbs.fa: Brad Singer, Kenn Kenaga & Pat Brennan, August 1999

content.description: Climb up a long curving thin crack that ends three-quarters of the way up the face and finish past two bolts to anchors at the top.
content.location: Far left side of the north face.

content.description:
Two hand cracks next to each other on the center-right side of black bluff north face.Black Bart is the left crack.

Great jamming on clean quality rock
content.protection:
standard rack to #3 blue camalot

bolted anchors atop
content.location: Located on the center-right side on the north face of black bluff.

content.description:
Climb the crack (hidden in the photo) on the right side inside of the chimney, or climb the chimney strictly to gain access to the ledge. Make some moves onto the face, then up to some small ledges. Anchors on the big ledge to the left on the tower, or continue up to the top of black bluff.

Another variation is to climb the chimney or the crack, then traverse over to the thin small roof portion that finishes on "Control Tower" anchors or link up the rest of "Best of Both Worlds".
content.protection:
Standard rack to #3 camalot

Couple runners for the ledges
content.location: Located on the right side on the north face of Black Bluff.

content.description:
Climbs a smooth face to vague arÃªte with technical footwork and intriguing moves.

This is a totally independent line and shares no climbing with

Shooting Star

.
content.location:
Starts 5 feet right of

Shooting Star

.

content.description:
Singer is justified in calling this one of the best 5.9 crack climbs in the SBs. It is a wonderful climb in a wonderful setting - nice and athletic with great moves up fine grained granite.

Work your way up the off width inside the flake, flakes and holds on the right prove most useful. The crux comes next with a hand traverse onto to a ledge on the left (very nice). Now follow the crack up over a couple of overlaps to the business. A splitter crack snakes it way up the face, but features to the left and good rest spots make this section a blast.

Finish up to the ledge in a flaring pod, which can be negotiated using face holds on either side.

Sit and ponder the expansive view while bringing up your second.
content.protection:
Standard rack of Friends #1 to #4. With a #5 at the start. Two bolt anchor - rappel off, 60m rope sufficient.

.
content.location: Right facing lieback flake on the right side of the north face.

content.description: Deep fists/off fists depending on size.Good feet,fun climb.
content.protection:
standard rack to #4 camalot

doubles in the bigger sizes

couple runners
content.location: Located on the center on the north face of black bluff.

content.description: Start up a wide section of crack in a left-facing corner, traverse left higher around a bush and finish up a long section of easier crack/face climbing to finish at a small pine tree.
content.location:
The obvious crack system between the block with

Control Tower

and

Aurora Borealis

.
